summary: A program that saves and tracks requested mods, and alerts you if there is an update to a mod you have installed.
descriptionHtml:
Changelog:
1.0.6 - bugfixes: error loading website bug, adult only content will now not be accepted.
       - features added: autosave whenever a mod is added or changed
1.0.5 - bug fixes: error when there is no version number, random \"changelog error\" warning
       - features added: loading screen (will get more advanced in the future), lists mods that need updates at the top. 
1.0.4 - fixed rare bug that caused version numbers to not load properly
1.0.3 - added features: ability to add urls just by the mod id number (11,4,etc).  Added a button to take you to the mods page, not just download page.
1.0.2 - screwed up release, fixed program
1.0.1 - release

[SIZE=15][U][B]Due to some issues this program will NOT work with adult only content![/B][/U][/SIZE]

I was getting annoyed with having to constantly check each individual mod I had installed to see if the version I had was different or if I needed to upgrade.  I also couldn\'t always remember what version of the mod I had installed.  So I looked and looked for a solution, but couldn\'t find one so I figured I\'d break out my Java skills and see what I can do.  After a couple of days of work this is the result!

Features:
- Allows dynamic adding/removal of mods
- Allows dynamic setting of currently installed version numbers
- Compares the currently installed version numbers of added mods to the SkyrimNexus website and determines whether or not an upgrade is in order.
- Shows 20 most recent changes to each mod
- Provides link to download page for each mod
- Saves added mods
- Loads saved mods and checks for updates each time the program is run

Tutorial:
-Open the mod manager
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/Uf1Dw.png[/IMG]
-Click Add Mod and copy the link to the mod from the skyrimnexus website
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/uGSIA.png[/IMG]
-Type in the version number you currently have installed (in this case it was the most recent version: 12) [B]MAKE SURE YOU TYPE IT IN EXACTLY AS IT APPEARS IN THE LATEST VERSION BOX LIKE THE ONE BELOW[/B]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/nMyx6.png[/IMG]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/B7HSK.png[/IMG]
-The mod is now added!  Be sure to hit save!
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/gXw9D.png[/IMG]
-I added another mod (The great STEP guide) but I have the old version installed.  After hitting Check Updates I get this message...
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/8AT2T.png[/IMG]
-...and a * appears next to the mod(s) that need updating
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/eMVFI.png[/IMG]
-On the side it shows the version number of the mod and the one I have installed
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/hJBE5.png[/IMG]
-After downloading and installing the latest version I hit the \"Set Version\" button and update the version I have installed to the one I just installed (in this case 1.79)
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/qQc7F.png[/IMG]
-Done!  Now all I have to do is Save and open this up the next time I want to check for updates.
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/dzgmf.png[/IMG]
author: superdean
